Have you ever wondered why some trees have leaves while others have “needles”? Mrs. Mott's 3rd Grade class at Plum Cove Elementary School was asked the question, "What tree type is better? Conifers or Deciduous?

Deciduous = The dropping of a part that is no longer needed, in this case leaves

Coniferous = Bearing pinecones, most coniferous are evergreens

In honor of Veterans' Day tomorrow, November 11, local Veterans' visited the East Gloucester Elementary School to read to the students.

Among the Veterans' that read were:

- Devan Smith of the Gloucester Coast Guard,
- Kevin Hicks of the Gloucester Police Department,
- Michael Grossi, East Gloucester School parent,
- Brendan O'Connor, Veteran of the Marine Corps,
- Ryan Hendrickson of the Gloucester Coast Guard, and
- Adam Curcuru, Veteran of the Marine Corps and Director of the Gloucester Veterans' Services

The children were taught about the meaning of Veterans' Day and read the book Veterans' Heroes in Our Neighborhood By Valerie Pfundstein.

Mrs. Donahue's 5th Grade Class at Plum Cove Elementary School took the Marshmallow Design Challenge. Each team is given 1 yard of tape, 1 yard of string, 20 pieces of long spaghetti, and 1 mini marshmallow. The teams had 18 minutes to construct a structure. Winning structure is the middle picture.

Also, Mr. Delisi's 1st grade class has been investigating wind throughout the month of October and this was a culminating engineering project. The focus question was, "What weather conditions are good for flying kites?" The students used weather tools like a wind scale and wind vane to measure the wind and decide if the wind was strong enough to push their kites into the sky.

September/October 2016 Plum Cove Elementary School Events:

On September 26, Adam Curcuru from the Cape Ann Veterans' Services helped raise the Blue Star Banner Flag for a Plum Cove kindergarten student whose father is currently serving on active duty. Petty Officer Jason Natti has served in The United States Coast Guard for 17 years. The entire Plum Cove School was outside to watch the ceremony. Thank you for your service Petty Officer Jason Natti.

Plum Cove Elementary School also held a Bus Evacuation Practice.
